issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After upgrading from 3.3.2 to 3.4.2 the following error was returned after attempting to access bucket ACLs for a given user using Jets3t:

{code}
org.jets3t.service.ServiceException: Failed to build XML document for ACL 
org.jets3t.service.ServiceException: Failed to build XML document for ACL 
at org.jets3t.service.acl.AccessControlList.toXml(AccessControlList.java:212) 
at org.jets3t.service.impl.rest.httpclient.RestStorageService.putAclImpl(RestStorageService.java:1618) 
at org.jets3t.service.impl.rest.httpclient.RestStorageService.putObjectAclImpl(RestStorageService.java:1590) 
at org.jets3t.service.StorageService.putObjectAcl(StorageService.java:1188) 
at org.jets3t.service.StorageService.putObjectAcl(StorageService.java:1161) 
at org.jets3t.service.multi.ThreadedStorageService$PutACLRunnable.run(ThreadedStorageService.java:1120) 
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:701) 
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException 
at org.jets3t.service.acl.AccessControlList.toXMLBuilder(AccessControlList.java:195) 
at org.jets3t.service.acl.AccessControlList.toXml(AccessControlList.java:210) 
... 6 more
{code}

Looking at the logs, it seems that the sytem failed to generate and assign canonical IDs (cloud-debug.log):

{code}
2014-05-13 15:06:52 ERROR | caught exception during upgrade, while attempting to generate and assign canonical ids 
Tue May 13 15:06:52 2014 ERROR [AccountEntity$AccountEntityUpgrade:main] [com.eucalyptus.auth.entities.AccountEntity$AccountEntityUpgrade.apply(AccountEntity.java):240] caught exception during upgrade, while attempting to generate and assign canonical ids
{code}
fields.summary: canonical ID replaced by NULL value after upgrade from 3.3.2 to 3.4.2

comments.body:
I have this reproduced in house with an upgrade from 3.3 to 3.4. The canonical_user_id is not getting generated/populated in the upgrade.
I am working on a groovy script to generate/populate the canonical_user_id for accounts that do not have them.

boto.s3.connection.get_canonical_user_id() output in 3.3 before upgrade

{code}
mmunn:~]boto-s3.py
send: 'GET /services/Walrus/ HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: 10.111.5.64:8773\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nDate: Fri, 16 May 2014 22:15:58 GMT\r\nContent-Length: 0\r\nAuthorization: AWS AAFNJOBVBOZ2PF7M4LVG8:fxyKtGTFN0a/gs1maLZN56WzCUs=\r\nUser-Agent: Boto/2.28.0 Python/2.7.3 Linux/3.11.10-100.fc18.x86_64\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Content-Length: 531
header: Content-Type: application/xml
u'698257613522'
None
{code}

boto.s3.connection.get_canonical_user_id() output in 3.4 after upgrade

{code}
[mmunn:~]boto-s3.py
send: 'GET /services/Walrus/ HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: 10.111.5.64:8773\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nDate: Fri, 16 May 2014 22:46:24 GMT\r\nContent-Length: 0\r\nAuthorization: AWS AAFNJOBVBOZ2PF7M4LVG8:w1PjnBHigyV6EDeKIHYTLV4d8iw=\r\nUser-Agent: Boto/2.28.0 Python/2.7.3 Linux/3.11.10-100.fc18.x86_64\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Content-Length: 510
header: Content-Type: application/xml
''
None
{code}

The upgrade is trying to generate  canonical ids at AccountEntity.java line 225 but is failing with the following error:
2014-05-16 15:43:26 ERROR | caught exception during upgrade, while attempting to generate and assign canonical ids

I have attached groovy script CanonicalUpdate.groovy to replace missing Canonical Ids.
To run this script use: euca-modify-property -f euca=CanonicalUpdate.groovy

Output from this script will list all updated accounts with new CanonicalIds
{code}
[a-22:~]euca-modify-property -f euca=CanonicalUpdate.groovy
PROPERTY	euca	Accounts with New CanonicalIds : 
 AccountName = eucalyptus , CanonicalId = f33381b3a3818633a2c3d3b145d3261c1a4d62d2f42591f3d2211435f405e433
 AccountName = one , CanonicalId = 3f1a4ed5371026183741910585d2a3338132112c2f1a5d2545333c55374a5848
 AccountName = three , CanonicalId = 1d4032265a262f142d534a435b355716561284d1863524a5a5b3f235c211b3b4
 AccountName = mike , CanonicalId = 183d5d5020195640243c11585b7614bbf14f4d3ab5b3e4c5921151c451de2e53
 AccountName = two , CanonicalId = 3b3f183c1a5e46f1e01256545d3941d40165f2e172571c3442f5883e40254d59 was executed successfully.
{code}
If there are no accounts missing CanonicalIds the output is:
{code}
[a-22:~]euca-modify-property -f euca=CanonicalUpdate.groovy
PROPERTY	euca	Accounts with New CanonicalIds : [ NONE ] was executed successfully.
{code}

[~jcarroll] The script should work fine with 4.0, I will test it today to make sure.

[~kedwards]  I need to test the fix for 3.4.3 again I will do that today.

[~jcarroll] Yes this script does work in 4.0.
Having said I am testing a fix for 4.0 right now so that we will not need the script. Either way the customer will be covered upgrading from 3.4.2 to 4.0

Canonical IDs are a pre-req for the upgrading to OSG in 4.0.0. So this was covered in upgrade code for 4.0.0 as well and should kick on all upgrades regardless of storage backend (Walrus or RiakCS) - 
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/testing/clc/modules/object-storage-common/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/objectstorage/entities/upgrade/ObjectStorage400Upgrade.java#L548

I added this code when I found out that accounts are still missing canonical IDs despite the 3.4.2 upgrade logic. I think we might have found the issue with the 3.4.2 upgrade logic failing to generate the canonical IDs, I'll let [~wwannemacher] elaborate on it.

The issue with the 3.4 upgrade logic is that Accounts does not have an appropriate AccountProvider. This causes a NullPointerException in [Accounts:142|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/testing/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/auth/Accounts.java#L142]. 

Right now, the upgrade for 4.0 will populate the canonical IDs, but going from X -> 3.4 will still have an issue.

@Wes Wannemacher  If you upgrade form 3.3 to 3.4 the canonical ID do not get populated. If you then upgrade from the upgraded 3.4 to 4.0. the canonical ID's will still not be populated. If the canonical ID's were populated in 3.4 before the upgrade to 4.0 you are ok. if a customer goes from 3.3 -> 3.4 -> 4.0 and never manually populated the canonical ID's  with the Canonical.update.groovy the accounts created in the 3.3 installation will not have canonical ID's.

[~mmunn1] I will try the upgrade from 3.4 to 4.0. 

This is something that [~swathi] was actively testing. In the upgrade to 4.0, was a log file generated? I'd be curious what went wrong in the upgrade to 4.0 because it is slightly different code (it should not generate a NullPointerException).

[~mmunn1], [~wwannemacher] has asked me to follow up on this. Upgrade to 4.0 should generate the missing canonical IDs. Are you seeing the issue where the cloud has been upgraded to 4.0.0 and the canonical IDs are still missing? If yes, can you point me to the logs or the setup?
@Swathi Yes I am seeing that the canonical IDs are still missing. setup=10.111.5.55

The missing conical ids are being populated on upgrade. The first upgrade I tried failed and I did not notice it with "Package eucalyptus-cc-4.0.0-0.0.1047.20140521git87cd0de3.el6.x86_64.rpm is not signed". With the successful upgrade using "yum --nogpgcheck" the conical ids are in fact being populated.
sorry for the confusion.

Code Review Request : EUCA-9417 canonical ID replaced by NULL value after upgrade from 3.3.2 to 3.4.2

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-9417

diff :  git show --color ba7220244a0dc9de85e83510871755173c594658

Summary: On upgrade from 3.3 to 3.4 Account.lookupAccountByCanonicalId 
was failing with an NPE because Accounts.accounts was no yet initialized
at upgrade time.

Solution: initialize Accounts.accounts in the AccountEntityUpgrade predicate.

Unit test : upgrade from 3.3 to 3.4 use boto or Eucalobo to make sure all canonicalID's are not null.

I have created testcase ./eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/4.0/Euca5959


Thx Mike
[~mmunn1], if the intention is for this to run on upgrade from 3.4.2 then you'd need to change the version annotation (and add a 3.4.3 version)
Right, though it looks like the version in the 3.4 maintenance branch is still 3.4.2 at the moment so that would need to be bumped also for this to work.
[~sjones] Got it, Thanks Steve!
[~kedwards] / [~mmunn1] - reviewed, looks fine to me!
Verified after 3.3.2 to 3.4.2 upgrade that I can properly list the cannonical IDs using boto. Also grepped the logs for "caught exception during upgrade" and did not see any issues.
